meta.content: Willow Springs School District :: Willow Springs, Missouri

img.alt: Willow Springs School District :: Willow Springs, Missouri

h2.strong: Coronavirus Information for Willow Springs Families

div.h2: SCHOOL CLOSURE FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR 2019-2020

ul.li:
By order of the Governor, schools are closed for the remainder of the school year due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
However, the distribution of meals, online learning resources and hard copy packets for Willow Springs students will continue. Monday, April 13, 2020 will be the second distribution of online learning resources and hard copy learning packets. The printed packets will be available between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Middle school and elementary school packets will be available at the elementary school. High school packets will be available at the high school. High school packets need to be requested ahead of time either by calling or emailing the high school. Even though school is closed for the year, the Willow Springs school district will continue providing learning resources for students and distribution of meals to children 18 years of age and younger. The meals will continue to be distributed on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 pm.

div.div:
There is no higher priority for our entire Willow Springs R-IV School District family than the safety of our students, staff and community. With the coronavirus being labeled a pandemic, many of our families have questions regarding the virus and the impact on our school community. I want to assure you that we are in close communication with local and state officials and internal teams, as well as continuing to monitor the websites of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS) in order to stay on top of this evolving situation.
Below are common questions we are receiving from our families and the public, along with our responses.
We hope these updates help reassure you that Willow Springs Schools is taking this situation very seriously, that we are adjusting our practices in response to new information from public health officials and that we continue to prioritize the safety and learning of our students.
How will the Willow Springs School District keep families, staff and students informed regarding coronavirus?
Any district updates will be conveyed through regular district channels – including email and voice messaging, the district website (willowspringsschool.com) and social media.
What is the protocol for cleaning and disinfecting schools and buses?
Staff have been directed to prioritize cleaning common and high-traffic areas multiple times a day and extra custodial help have been hired to assist in this process. Prioritized cleaning includes bathrooms, the cafeteria, common spaces, door handles, emergency bar on doors, etc. All efforts will be made to keep students healthy and safe.
Will school events and travel be canceled?
School events, including athletics and local field trips, are canceled for the remainder of the school year.
What conversations should parents have with their children at home?
We know families, staff and students are concerned. We are committed to keeping you informed and working with you to keep our school communities safe. Would you like some resources to share with your children? Here’s an informative graphic resource from NPR.
Where can I turn for more information?
CDC
WHO
Howell County Health Department
Missouri Department of Health
Map the spread
Rest assured, we are monitoring this developing situation closely, staying in regular contact with federal agencies, health organizations and other experts. We will continue to adjust our operations according to the recommendations of health authorities as the situation develops. If you have questions, contact your child’s school or call the Howell County Health Department at (417) 256-7078.
Also, on March 11, the MO DHSS opened a statewide public hotline for citizens needing guidance regarding COVID-19. That hotline is operated by medical professionals and is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The phone number is (877) 435-8411.

ul.li: The week of April 27, 2020 will be a busy week for Willow Springs’ parents and students. Student belongings may be picked up beginning on Monday from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. We prefer the first day of pickup to be for 12th grade, 8th grade and 4th grade students along with siblings. The rest of the week is open for pickup of student belongings by all other students from 8:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
Also on Monday will be the next round of learning packets to be picked up and our regular meal distribution from 11:00 am to 12:30 p.m.
Meals will continue to be distributed to children 18 and younger through the school closure and during the summer months.

ol.li: Any parent or guardian who signed medication in at the nurses’ office for the 2019-20 school year, please be prepared to pick this up when picking up your child's belongings from school next week. If you have children in all 3 buildings (elementary, MS and HS) and have checked in medicine for them, you will pick this medication up in the elementary pick up line.
If you are sending someone else to pick up your child's belongings, please know that any medication that was signed in for this school year will be sent with the designated person.
Any medication that the parent or guardian signed in that is considered a controlled substance will need to be picked up and signed out by the parent or guardian only.
Any medication not picked up by Friday, May 1st, 2020 will be destroyed per school policy.

td.div:
Dates Announced to Retrieve Student Items: Student lockers and desks are in the process of being cleaned out. Student personal items will be placed in bags and identified by name. These may be picked up by students or parents the week of Monday, April 27th. Staff will be on hand to distribute the bags to students at the entrances to each of the schools according to the following schedule:
- Monday, April 27, 2020 (8:00 a.m. – 3:00 p.m.): 12th, 8th, and 4th graders (may also pick up siblings’ belongings)
- Tuesday, April 28, - Friday, May 1 (8:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.): remaining students
Students need to return any school textbooks, library books or other school property at the time they come to retrieve their personal items. Elementary students: please return the lunch cards that are attached to your backpacks. All student items need to be picked up no later than Friday, May 1, 2020.
Online Resources and Learning Packets: There will be one more distribution of online resources and printed learning packets which will be for the final three weeks of the school year. This last update will be available on Monday, April 27th.
- Elementary students may pick these up during the meal distribution.
- Middle school and high school students will pick up their learning packets between the hours of 8:00 am – 3:00 p.m. on that day, and anytime the remainder of that week between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 12:30 p.m.
- All students who would like printed learning packets must call their respective school to order a packet prior to Monday, April 27th.
Summer School: The district is currently examining options for summer school and will communicate those to students and parents in the near future. All options are being considered including summer school to take place in June and running through July, or summer school beginning in July and running through the first week of August. The district believes it is important that students have face to face learning opportunities if possible prior to the start of the 2020-21 school year.

By order of the Governor, schools are closed for the remainder of the school year due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
However, the distribution of meals, online learning resources and hard copy packets for Willow Springs students will continue. Monday, April 13, 2020 will be the second distribution of online learning resources and hard copy learning packets. The printed packets will be available between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Middle school and elementary school packets will be available at the elementary school. High school packets will be available at the high school. High school packets need to be requested ahead of time either by calling or emailing the high school. Even though school is closed for the year, the Willow Springs school district will continue providing learning resources for students and distribution of meals to children 18 years of age and younger. The meals will continue to be distributed on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 pm.

- Graduation: Every senior will graduate and we WILL have a ceremony. Right now, the ceremony is still scheduled for May 8. If we can't do it then, we will keep pushing it back until we find an acceptable date.
- Prom: Prom (Branson) has been cancelled and full refunds will be mailed to parents. If we come back to school this year, we will make an effort to have a local prom. If we are out for the remainder of the year, prom will be cancelled.
- Senior Projects: Every senior completed their product! Well done! If we return to school on April 27, we will still have a presentation night without a community showcase or trifolds. If we are out beyond April 27, presentations will be cancelled.
- Senior Trip: Scheduled for May 6. It has been moved from St. Louis to Branson. If school is still out on May 6, the trip will be cancelled.

Willow Springs schools will continue to be closed through Friday, April 24, 2020 due to public health concerns related to the spread of the Coronavirus. The distribution of meals to students will continue on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at the elementary school pickup and drop off area. The next set of online learning resources and paper learning packets will be made available to students on Monday, April 13, 2020. Please continue to monitor the district’s Facebook page and website for additional information.

Several updates regarding meals and assignments:
- First, meals will again be distributed tomorrow, Wednesday, March 25. However, the times and process for distribution will be different. Meals will be distributed from 11:00 am to 12:30 pm at the drop off and pick up location at the elementary school. We will follow Governor Parsons’ order and maintain six feet of separation in all interactions. This will no longer be a “grab and go” approach. Individuals who come to pick up meals will need to exit their vehicles to pick up meals off tables designated for that purpose. We ask that you maintain six feet of separation from school staff and from others who are picking up meals. You will receive instructions on how we plan when you arrive to pick up your meal.
- Second, for those of you who have requested printed packets for the elementary school and middle school, these will also be distributed at this time. The same rule for six feet of separation will apply. Printed packets can also be picked up at any school between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. You will need to push the buzzer at the door and the packets will be brought to you.
- Finally, online resources will be available to you Wednesday morning at 8:00 a.m. You will receive an email and a Facebook post with the link to access these learning resources.
School continues to remain closed due to the coronavirus outbreak through Friday, April 3, 2020, but you may contact your child’s school anytime between 8:00 am and 3:00 pm should you have questions. Thank you!

div.u: Governor Parsons Announces Statewide Social Distancing Order/Schools to Remain Closed
div.br:
Effective Monday, March 23, 2020 at 12:01 am, social distancing guidelines will be implemented in the state of Missouri. Details of the these new guidelines can be found at KY3.
As part of this order, Governor Parsons ordered schools to remain closed until at least April 6, 2020. At this time the Willow Springs school district still plans to distribute meals on a drive through basis beginning Monday morning, March 23, 2020 at 10:00 a.m.

Teachers are designing lessons by grade level and content area that will be available to students both online or in hard copy packet form. These same activities will be available online beginning on Wednesday, March 25, 2020. We would rather students take advantage of the online version of these activities if students have internet connectivity at home or if they have other access to the internet. In the event that students do not have access to the internet and would like a printed copy of these activities, please call your child’s school and request a printed packet. The printed learning packets will also be available on Wednesday, March 25th. Printed packets for elementary students will be distributed during the meal distribution between the hours of 10:00 am and 12:00 p.m. If not receiving a meal, you may pick up a packet anytime between 8:00 am and 3:00 p.m. Middle school and high school students should contact their respective schools to make arrangements to get a printed packet.
No Statewide Mandate for School Closing
There has been some miscommunication on Governor Parson’s position on school closings in Missouri. There has been no statewide mandated closing of schools across Missouri. Governor Parsons did announce that all 555 school districts in the state of Missouri closed voluntarily. These were all local decisions. As such, the Willow Springs school district will be closed through April 3, 2020. After consulting with local and state health officials, a decision will be made as we approach that date as to whether or not to extend the closure further.
What If the School Closure Lasts Longer Than Anticipated?
There have been a number of questions about how the school closing will impact such events as the high school prom and graduation. At this time there is no answer to that question because it is unknown how long our schools will remain closed. We are working diligently in the background developing plans in the event that schools must stay closed longer than what any of us would like, but what is safe for our students, our staff and the community. The school district will always keep the best interests of our students, your children, at the center of our planning and decision making as we move forward.

div.strong: Meal distribution set up for students.

strong.font: Spring break extended through Friday, April 3, 2020.

div.br: All spring activities including sports practices are suspended.

td.div:
Destination Imagination Canceled
State Chess Canceled
From Missouri State High School Sports Athletic Association:
Upon the recommendation from the Green County Director of Public Health and in consultation with Missouri State University, the Missouri State High School Activities Association (MSHSAA) will be making adjustments to the access allowed at this weekend’s Show-Me Showdown. With a confirmed case of COVID-19 in the state and concern for the safety of all who will be working and attending the Show-Me Showdown, each school will be given 150 wristbands to distribute to its fans base. Only fans that have been given a wristband will be allowed in the arena. The distribution of the wristbands will be the responsibility of the school. Only essential school personnel will be allowed access to the arena as well. Any tickets previously purchased are now void. The MSHSAA Office will work with the participating schools on any reimbursements that need to be made. All games from this weekend will be streamed at MSHSAA.tv

Spring Break Travel As we approach spring break, we know many of you will be traveling and we encourage you to use healthy precautions and follow CDC travel guidelines which are being updated frequently.
